definition: to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
other/another/separate/separately
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)

sentences.english: Seeing this, people considered Uncle Gen as someone and looked at him with owe.
sentences.chinese: 衆人一看，根叔還真有點料，立刻對他另眼相看。

sentences.english: But also to make Arui him a new light?
sentences.chinese: 但同時也使阿瑞對他另眼相看。

sentences.english: Eg. people do look up to you if you speak good English.
sentences.chinese: 如果你說得一口漂亮的英語，人們會對你另眼相看。

sentences.english: QiaoJinFan help company tide, the directors look favourably upon him.
sentences.chinese: 喬津帆幫公司力挽狂瀾，董事們對他另眼相看。

sentences.english: Tom is regarded with favour by his supervisor.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆另眼相看他的上司。

sentences.english: Pitt's money and acres had a great effect upon his brother.
sentences.chinese: 佩特如今有錢又有地，所以他的弟弟也對他另眼相看。

definition: to have a whole new level of respect for sb or sth/to sit up and take notice (of sb's improved performance etc)
deference/esteem/to admire
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
deeply grateful
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
to attach importance to sth/to value
to hold sb in the same regard as one would a god (idiom)
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to be hell-bent on/dead set on sth/unswerving
extremely (placed after verb or adjective)
to submit cheerfully/to accept willingly (idiom)
good opinion/favorable impression
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to treat sb with due respect (idiom)
generous treatment
